Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for navigating the robot to specific coordinates.
    Author:
    Ege Ozer, Mitchell Keeley

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(Odometer odo,
                  SampleProvider colorSensorRight,
                  float[] colorDataRight,
                  SampleProvider colorSensorLeft,
                  float[] colorDataLeft)
        Parameters:
        odo - odometer values are passed through Odometer type
        colorSensorRight - right light sensor general initial information is passed through SampleProvider type
        colorDataRight - right light sensor fetching values are passed through float[] type
        colorSensorLeft - left light sensor general initial information is passed through SampleProvider type
        colorDataLeft - left light sensor fetching values are passed through float[] type

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeeds

        public void setSpeeds(int lSpd,
                      int rSpd)
        Function to set the motor speeds jointly

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
        TravelTo function which takes as arguments the x and y position in cm Will travel to designated position, while constantly updating it's heading NOTE:** this method is not used in the last version of the code, travelXY is used instead

      • travelToXY

        public void travelToXY(double finalX,
                       double finalY,
                       Odometer odo)
        This method is the main navigation method used for the final demo. This methods takes as parameters the x and y value of the final destination and it will go there by moving only straight in x or y directions. It will first travel along the x then go straight along the y direction. This way of navigation is strictly designed for avoiding restricted areas
        Parameters:
        finalX - x coordinate parameter
        finalY - y coordinate parameter
        odo - odometer values are passed through this parameter

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double angle,
                   boolean stop)
        TurnTo function which takes an angle and boolean as arguments. The boolean controls whether or not to stop the motors when the turn is completed
        Parameters:
        angle - parameter that takes a specific angle for the robot to turn to
        stop - boolean value that is set to true to stop motors, false otherwise

      • clawOutTurnTo

        public void clawOutTurnTo(double angle,
                          boolean stop)
        TurnTo function which takes an angle and boolean as arguments. The only difference between the normal turn to and this is that the track width value is different. The boolean controls whether or not to stop the motors when the turn is completed
        Parameters:
        angle - parameter that takes a specific angle for the robot to turn to
        stop - boolean value that is set to true to stop motors, false otherwise

      • goToDisp

        public void goToDisp(int bx,
                     int by,
                     int fireLineY,
                     java.lang.String dispOrientation)
        method to determine how the robot travels to the dispencer while avoiding the restricted areas of the playing field, and orients itself based on the specified orientation of the ball dispenser. Also indicates whether the robot has completed its attempt to reach the ball dispenser.
        Parameters:
        bx - is the grid line position of the ball dispenser on the x-axis
        by - is the grid line position of the ball dispenser on the y-axis
        fireLineY - is the grid line position of the firing line on the y-axis
        dispOrientation - is the cardinal orientation of the ball dispenser

      • goToFireLine

        public void goToFireLine(int targetX,
                         int fireLineY)
        method to determine how the robot travels to the firing line and is correctly facing upfield, while avoiding the restricted areas of the playing field. Also indicates whether the robot has completed its attempt to reach the firing line.
        Parameters:
        targetX - is the grid line position of the target on the x-axis
        fireLineY - is the grid line position of the firing line on the y-axis

      • goToDefLine

        public void goToDefLine(int targetX,
                        int defLineY)
        method to determine how the robot travels to the desired defense position and is correctly facing downfield, while avoiding the restricted areas of the playing field. Also indicates whether the robot has completed its attempt to reach a defense position.
        Parameters:
        targetX - is the grid line position of the target on the x-axis
        defLineY - is the grid line position of the desired defense position on the y-axis

      • turnImm

        public void turnImm(double angle)
        Turn Immediate method is coded when it is required for the robot to turn a specific set angle, no matter where the initial angle is.
        Parameters:
        angle - parameter that takes an angle to turn the robot by

      • goForward

        public void goForward(double distance)
        Go forward a set distance in cm
        Parameters:
        distance - is the distance to go forward

      • goBackward

        public void goBackward(double distance)
        Go backward a set distance in cm
        Parameters:
        distance - is the distance to go backward

      • convertDistance

        private static int convertDistance(double radius,
                                   double distance)
        Converts a desired distance in cm into the radians required to move the robot said distance
        Parameters:
        radius - is the radius of the wheels
        distance - is the distance to be traveled
        Returns:

      • convertAngle

        private static int convertAngle(double radius,
                                double width,
                                double angle)
        Converts a desired change in heading in degrees into the radians required to rotate the robot said amount
        Parameters:
        radius - is the radius of the wheels
        width - is the track width of the robot
        angle - is the angle for the robot to turn
        Returns:
